properties.areaDesc: Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 9 at 3:40PM MST until February 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM EXPECTED TO BRING HEAVY SNOW OVER THE SACRAMENTO
MOUNTAINS...

. Upper level closed low is expected to combine with a cold front
and and bring winter weather conditions over souther New Mexico
from Monday night through late Tuesday night. Temperatures will
drop below freezing on Monday evening which will allow the
transition from rain to snow over the Sacs. Periods of moderate
to heavy snow are possible with this system from Monday night
through late Tuesday night. Snow accumulations are expected to be
between 6 to 12 inches with isolated greater amounts. The snow
should end by Wednesday morning.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12
inches and isolated greater amounts possible.

* WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico in the Sacramento
Mountains.

* WHEN...From Monday night at 11 PM MST through late Tuesday
night.

* TIMING... Occasional moderate to heavy snow through late Tuesday
night.

* IMPACTS... Travel could be very difficult. Some roads could
become impassable and/or closed.
properties.instruction:
Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT
